body: I think it's expected that it only shows the child classes; you can configure any option on a child class, whether it's defined there or on a base class. And for me, `%config TerminalIInteractiveShell` does show `TerminalInteractiveShell.history_length`.

Nope, for me the `%config TerminalIInteractiveShell` doesn't work, either with `traitlets-4.3.1` or latest `5.0.0.dev`; I get the above usage-error.

```
>>> sys.version
'3.5.3 (v3.5.3:1880cb95a742, Jan 16 2017, 15:51:26) [MSC v.1900 32 bit (Intel)]'

$ uname -a  # Irrelevant
CYGWIN_NT-10.0 tokoti 2.6.1(0.305/5/3) 2016-12-16 11:55 x86_64 Cygwin

$ pip list |grep -iE "ipython|trait|console"
ipython (5.1.0)
ipython-genutils (0.1.0)
ipython-sql (0.3.8)
jupyter-console (5.0.0)
qtconsole (4.2.1)
traitlets (4.3.1)
traittypes (0.0.6)
win-unicode-console (0.5)
```

That's weird. I've double checked, and it's definitely there on both Python 2 and 3, with traitlets from master.

We don't officially support using it on Cygwin, but I can't see how it would affect this.

Actually I'm not running ipython on *cygwin*'s python (which is python-2) but on [WinPython-3.5.3](http://winpython.github.io/) (version updated in respective comment, above).

This is really strange.
How can I help debug it?

I followed down the code that actually does that, and it's ultimately calling `dir(cls)` to get the list of attributes. So can you try this:

```
 4│ from IPython.terminal.interactiveshell import TerminalInteractiveShell

 5│ 'history_length' in dir(TerminalInteractiveShell)
 5> True
```

If that's True for you, can you dig through the code to see if the versions you have reach the same code as mine? The config magic is defined here: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/5.2.1/IPython/core/magics/config.py#L38

Indeed I get true, like you do.

Did you check my OP suggestion of of using `mro()` in: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/master/IPython/core/magics/config.py#L113 ?

I get the feeling that this is maybe the problem (and then, it is strange that it works for your in the first place).

I saw it, but I don't think it's necessary.

Going up from dir(), can you try:

- `traitlets.getmembers(TerminalInteractiveShell)`
- `TerminalInteractiveShell.class_traits()`
- `TerminalInteractiveShell.class_get_help(get_ipython())` (this needs to be inside IPython)

That's the stack of calls that is involved in the code I see on my system.

>>>  print(TerminalInteractiveShell.class_get_help(get_ipython()))
TerminalInteractiveShell options
--------------------------------
--TerminalInteractiveShell.ast_node_interactivity=<Enum>
    Current: 'last_expr'
    Choices: ['all', 'last', 'last_expr', 'none']
    'all', 'last', 'last_expr' or 'none', specifying which nodes should be run
    interactively (displaying output from expressions).
--TerminalInteractiveShell.ast_transformers=<List>
    Current: []
    A list of ast.NodeTransformer subclass instances, which will be applied to
    user input before code is run.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.autocall=<Enum>
    Current: 0
    Choices: (0, 1, 2)
    Make IPython automatically call any callable object even if you didn't type
    explicit parentheses. For example, 'str 43' becomes 'str(43)' automatically.
    The value can be '0' to disable the feature, '1' for 'smart' autocall, where
    it is not applied if there are no more arguments on the line, and '2' for
    'full' autocall, where all callable objects are automatically called (even
    if no arguments are present).
--TerminalInteractiveShell.autoindent=<Bool>
    Current: True
    Autoindent IPython code entered interactively.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.automagic=<Bool>
    Current: True
    Enable magic commands to be called without the leading %.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.banner1=<Unicode>
    Current: 'Python 3.5.3 (v3.5.3:1880cb95a742, Jan 16 2017, 16:02:32) [MSC v.1900 64 bit (AMD64)]\nType "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.\n\nIPython 5.1.0 -- An enhanced Interactive Python.\n?         -> Introduction and overview of IPython\'s features.\n%quickref -> Quick reference.\nhelp      -> Python\'s own help system.\nobject?   -> Details about \'object\', use \'object??\' for extra details.\n'
    The part of the banner to be printed before the profile
--TerminalInteractiveShell.banner2=<Unicode>
    Current: ''
    The part of the banner to be printed after the profile
--TerminalInteractiveShell.cache_size=<Int>
    Current: 1000
    Set the size of the output cache.  The default is 1000, you can change it
    permanently in your config file.  Setting it to 0 completely disables the
    caching system, and the minimum value accepted is 20 (if you provide a value
    less than 20, it is reset to 0 and a warning is issued).  This limit is
    defined because otherwise you'll spend more time re-flushing a too small
    cache than working
--TerminalInteractiveShell.color_info=<Bool>
    Current: True
    Use colors for displaying information about objects. Because this
    information is passed through a pager (like 'less'), and some pagers get
    confused with color codes, this capability can be turned off.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.colors=<CaselessStrEnum>
    Current: 'Neutral'
    Choices: ['Neutral', 'NoColor', 'LightBG', 'Linux']
    Set the color scheme (NoColor, Neutral, Linux, or LightBG).
--TerminalInteractiveShell.confirm_exit=<Bool>
    Current: True
    Set to confirm when you try to exit IPython with an EOF (Control-D in Unix,
    Control-Z/Enter in Windows). By typing 'exit' or 'quit', you can force a
    direct exit without any confirmation.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.debug=<Bool>
    Current: False
--TerminalInteractiveShell.deep_reload=<Bool>
    Current: False
    **Deprecated**
    Will be removed in IPython 6.0
    Enable deep (recursive) reloading by default. IPython can use the
    deep_reload module which reloads changes in modules recursively (it replaces
    the reload() function, so you don't need to change anything to use it).
    `deep_reload` forces a full reload of modules whose code may have changed,
    which the default reload() function does not.  When deep_reload is off,
    IPython will use the normal reload(), but deep_reload will still be
    available as dreload().
--TerminalInteractiveShell.disable_failing_post_execute=<Bool>
    Current: False
    Don't call post-execute functions that have failed in the past.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.display_completions=<Enum>
    Current: 'multicolumn'
    Choices: ('column', 'multicolumn', 'readlinelike')
    Options for displaying tab completions, 'column', 'multicolumn', and
    'readlinelike'. These options are for `prompt_toolkit`, see `prompt_toolkit`
    documentation for more information.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.display_page=<Bool>
    Current: False
    If True, anything that would be passed to the pager will be displayed as
    regular output instead.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.editing_mode=<Unicode>
    Current: 'emacs'
    Shortcut style to use at the prompt. 'vi' or 'emacs'.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.editor=<Unicode>
    Current: 'vim'
    Set the editor used by IPython (default to $EDITOR/vi/notepad).
--TerminalInteractiveShell.enable_html_pager=<Bool>
    Current: False
    (Provisional API) enables html representation in mime bundles sent to
    pagers.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.highlight_matching_brackets=<Bool>
    Current: True
    Highlight matching brackets .
--TerminalInteractiveShell.highlighting_style=<Unicode>
    Current: 'legacy'
    The name of a Pygments style to use for syntax highlighting:  vs, algol_nu,
    emacs, rrt, colorful, friendly, murphy, monokai, paraiso-dark, algol,
    autumn, vim, trac, tango, igor, native, borland, pastie, xcode, paraiso-
    light, perldoc, default, lovelace, manni, fruity, bw
--TerminalInteractiveShell.highlighting_style_overrides=<Dict>
    Current: {}
    Override highlighting format for specific tokens
--TerminalInteractiveShell.history_length=<Int>
    Current: 10000
    Total length of command history
--TerminalInteractiveShell.history_load_length=<Int>
    Current: 1000
    The number of saved history entries to be loaded into the history buffer at
    startup.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.ipython_dir=<Unicode>
    Current: 'D:\\Home\\ankostis\\.ipython'
--TerminalInteractiveShell.logappend=<Unicode>
    Current: ''
    Start logging to the given file in append mode. Use `logfile` to specify a
    log file to **overwrite** logs to.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.logfile=<Unicode>
    Current: ''
    The name of the logfile to use.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.logstart=<Bool>
    Current: False
    Start logging to the default log file in overwrite mode. Use `logappend` to
    specify a log file to **append** logs to.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.mouse_support=<Bool>
    Current: False
    Enable mouse support in the prompt
--TerminalInteractiveShell.object_info_string_level=<Enum>
    Current: 0
    Choices: (0, 1, 2)
--TerminalInteractiveShell.pdb=<Bool>
    Current: False
    Automatically call the pdb debugger after every exception.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.prompt_in1=<Unicode>
    Current: 'In [\\#]: '
    Deprecated since IPython 4.0 and ignored since 5.0, set
    TerminalInteractiveShell.prompts object directly.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.prompt_in2=<Unicode>
    Current: '   .\\D.: '
    Deprecated since IPython 4.0 and ignored since 5.0, set
    TerminalInteractiveShell.prompts object directly.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.prompt_out=<Unicode>
    Current: 'Out[\\#]: '
    Deprecated since IPython 4.0 and ignored since 5.0, set
    TerminalInteractiveShell.prompts object directly.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.prompts_class=<Type>
    Current: <class 'IPython.terminal.prompts.Prompts'>
    Class used to generate Prompt token for prompt_toolkit
--TerminalInteractiveShell.prompts_pad_left=<Bool>
    Current: True
    Deprecated since IPython 4.0 and ignored since 5.0, set
    TerminalInteractiveShell.prompts object directly.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.quiet=<Bool>
    Current: False
--TerminalInteractiveShell.separate_in=<SeparateUnicode>
    Current: '\n'
--TerminalInteractiveShell.separate_out=<SeparateUnicode>
    Current: ''
--TerminalInteractiveShell.separate_out2=<SeparateUnicode>
    Current: ''
--TerminalInteractiveShell.show_rewritten_input=<Bool>
    Current: True
    Show rewritten input, e.g. for autocall.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.simple_prompt=<Bool>
    Current: False
    Use `raw_input` for the REPL, without completion, multiline input, and
    prompt colors.
    Useful when controlling IPython as a subprocess, and piping STDIN/OUT/ERR.
    Known usage are: IPython own testing machinery, and emacs inferior-shell
    integration through elpy.
    This mode default to `True` if the `IPY_TEST_SIMPLE_PROMPT` environment
    variable is set, or the current terminal is not a tty.
--TerminalInteractiveShell.space_for_menu=<Int>
    Current: 6
    Number of line at the bottom of the screen to reserve for the completion
    menu
--TerminalInteractiveShell.sphinxify_docstring=<Bool>
    Current: False
    Enables rich html representation of docstrings. (This requires the docrepr
    module).
--TerminalInteractiveShell.term_title=<Bool>
    Current: True
    Automatically set the terminal title
--TerminalInteractiveShell.true_color=<Bool>
    Current: False
    Use 24bit colors instead of 256 colors in prompt highlighting. If your
    terminal supports true color, the following command should print 'TRUECOLOR'
    in orange: printf "\x1b[38;2;255;100;0mTRUECOLOR\x1b[0m\n"
--TerminalInteractiveShell.wildcards_case_sensitive=<Bool>
    Current: True
--TerminalInteractiveShell.xmode=<CaselessStrEnum>
    Current: 'Context'
    Choices: ['Context', 'Plain', 'Verbose']

So all of those contain `history_length`, and as far as I can see, the last one is what's called when you do `%config TerminalInteractiveShell`:

https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/5.2.1/IPython/core/magics/config.py#L129

It seems that in my case it falls through the line [`L124: elif line in classnames:`](https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/5.2.1/IPython/core/magics/config.py#L124) 
while it shouldn't, and it reaches [` L137: elif '=' not in line:`](https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/5.2.1/IPython/core/magics/config.py#L137), and I get the `UsageError`  exception.

So according to my rough understanding, it is the `classnames` in L124 that is problematic.
My apologizies if I'm assuming stuff and not testing them with a debugger - I'm really up to the neck with a deadlined release.
`%config TerminalIInteractiveShell` has a typo (two `I`s). Is that relevant?

Yes, that's it!

Have no idea how the typo ended up in my command.
Apologize for wasting your time.
Heh, no worries. It's always the little things.
